SEARCH
Package gw.api.database

Interface IQueryResult<QT extends Bean,RT>

All Superinterfaces:
IQueryResultSet<RT>, Iterable<RT>
All Known Subinterfaces:
IQueryBeanResult<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArchivedClaimSearchResults, AssignmentSearchResult, CCQueryBeanResultWithSummary, ClaimSearchResults, FreeTextClaimSearchResults, com.guidewire.pl.system.database.impl.ListQueryProcessor, QueryBeanResultWithSummary, com.guidewire.pl.system.database.impl.QueryProcessorBase, RuleListPageHelper.RuleQueryResults, SolrQueryProcessor, StandardQueryBeanResultWithSummary, com.guidewire.pl.system.database.impl.WrappingQueryProcessor
public interface IQueryResult<QT extends Bean,RT> extends IQueryResultSet<RT>, Iterable<RT>
A QueryProcessor represents a result from a database query. QueryProcessor objects are materialized from a Query object. The Query is strictly a server side entity, so this implies that query results can only be materialized on in the server.

    • getCount

      int getCount()
      Returns the approximate count of entities in the results.

      WARNING: This executes a count(*) query so it is neither cheap nor atomic. Thus when the results are counted and then subsequently retrieved, the number of results may actually be different from the number returned by the iterator. Nevertheless calling this method can be cheaper than iterating over lots of entities (which are loaded into memory) and maintaining a count to test whether or not to proceed with the iteration.

      Returns:
      The approximate count of entities in the results.

    • getCountLimitedBy

      int getCountLimitedBy(int limit)
      Returns the number of entities in the results limited by the given integer result. This is not cheap but may, on some databases, be a little cheaper than calling getCount() > limit, because specifying the limit allows the database to stop processing rows once the number of rows exceeds the given limit.
      Parameters:
      limit - Must be greater than zero
      Returns:
      An accurate count if the actual count is less than the limit, otherwise the limit.

    • setPageSize

      void setPageSize(int iRows)
      Sets the page size in terms of the number of rows per page. Rows in the results are fetched a page at a time when rows are iterated.

      A number less than or equal to zero indicates all rows are returned in a single page. This is typically not an advisable setting.

      Parameters:
      iRows - Number of rows per page. If invalid input: '<'= 0, all rows are included in a single page.

    • isCapped

      boolean isCapped()
      Returns:
      true if the search results had to be capped.

    • addPersistentFilter

      void addPersistentFilter(IQueryFilter filter)
      Adds filter to this query that persists and won't be cleared by clearNonPersistentFilters(). If the filter is null, this is treated like a no-op.
      Parameters:
      filter - the filter to add. From Gosu, this should be an instance of StandardQueryFilter.

    • addFilter

      void addFilter(IQueryFilter filter)
      Adds a filter to this query. If the filter is null, this is treated like a no-op.
      Parameters:
      filter - the filter to add. From Gosu, this should be an instance of StandardQueryFilter.

    • clearFilters

      void clearFilters()
      Clears all filters on this query.

    • clearNonPersistentFilters

      void clearNonPersistentFilters()
      Clears only non-persistent filters on this query.

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if and only if this query processor does not have any results. Note that this method executes the query, so for performance reasons it should not be followed by calls to any other methods of this interface that attempt to count the number of query results or that attempt to get one or more of the results themselves.
      Returns:
      true if this query processor does not have any results

    • getAnyResult

      RT getAnyResult()
      Returns this processor's one arbitrary result if it has one. Otherwise returns null. This method has the side effect of setting the chunking processor to 1.
      Returns:
      the arbitrary result

    • getFirstResult

      RT getFirstResult()
      Returns this processor's first result if it has one. Otherwise returns null. This method has the side effect of setting the chunking processor.
      Returns:
      the first result
      See Also:
      • getAtMostOneRow()

    • getAtMostOneRow

      RT getAtMostOneRow() throws MultipleMatchesException
      Returns this processor's first result if it has one. Otherwise returns null. Throws an exception if this processor contains multiple results.

      This method has the side effect of setting the chunking processor.

      Returns:
      The processor's first result, or null if no result exists
      Throws:
      MultipleMatchesException - if this processor has multiple results. Clients can catch this exception and throw a different exception with a more detailed error message.
      See Also:
      • getFirstResult()

    • iterator

      Iterator<RT> iterator(int startRow)
      Returns an iterator of beans for the results of this query starting at startRow. For example, If the startRow value is 1, the next record will be the second row. If the startRow value is negative, it will be ignored
      Parameters:
      startRow - the index of next row to return relative to the result set
      Returns:
      an iterator of beans for the results of this query starting at startRow
